text.div:
This code system http://mitwfhir.dicom.org.tw/fhir/CodeSystem/NASH-Necroinflammatory-Grading defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
1 Grade 1 (mild)Steatosis (mainly macrovesicular) involving up to 66% of lobules; occasional balloned perivenular hepatocytes; scattered neutrophils with or without lymphocytes; no or mild chronic portal inflammation.
2 Grade 2 (moderate)Steatosis of any degree; obvious ballooning (mainly perivenular); intralobular neutrophils, may be associated with perivenular pericellular fibrosis if evident; mild to moderate portal and intralobular chronic inflammation.
3 Grade 3 (severe)Panlobular steatosis; obvious perivenular ballooning and disarray; marked lobular inflammation; neutrophils may be concentrated in perivenular areas of ballooning and in areas of pericellular fibrosis if evident. Portal inflammation mild or moderate.
